identifyUser.description: Create or update user information and traits in LogRocket to contextualize user behavior.

props.name: orgId
props.description: Your LogRocket organization ID (found in Settings > General Settings, or in your App ID before the slash)

props.name: appId
props.description: Your LogRocket app/project ID (found in Settings > General Settings, or in your App ID after the slash)

props.name: userId
props.description: The unique identifier for the user

props.name: timestamp
props.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds indicating when this data was collected (optional)

props.name: traits
props.description: User traits as key-value pairs (e.g., {"plan": "free", "age": 43}). Values will be converted to strings.

requestHighlights.description: Request session highlights for a user. Results will be sent to the webhook URL when ready.

props.name: orgId
props.description: Your LogRocket organization ID (found in Settings > General Settings, or in your App ID before the slash)

props.name: projectId
props.description: Your LogRocket project ID (found in Settings > General Settings, or in your App ID after the slash)

props.name: userEmail
props.description: The email of the user to get highlights for

props.name: userId
props.description: The ID of the user from LogRocket.identify() calls

props.name: timeRangeStart
props.description: Start of the time range for sessions (optional)

props.name: timeRangeEnd
props.description: End of the time range for sessions (optional)

props.name: webhookUrl
props.description: URL where highlights results will be posted when ready. You can get this from the "Highlights Ready" trigger.

highlightsReady.description: Trigger when session highlights are ready. Use this webhook URL when requesting highlights.
